ratings.comment: Seidenberg is an expert in his field. His lectures are not the best and the class is hard, but that's the price of taking a class with a great researcher. He wrote the book used in the class and he is an amazing writer. Use his office hours because he is better one on one. Not outstanding, but very nice. Deserves better than the low rating he has.

Clearly an expert (literally wrote the book for the course), but teaching seems like a side job. His attendance and planning was erratic. Weekly quizzes a mess and often regraded. Lectures are vague and meandering but tests and homework demand deep understanding of material. Syllabus stated to expect to learn a lot on your own - he wasn't kidding.

Professor Seidenberg is extremely educated and an expert in the field, however he does not convey that whatsoever. Lectures drag on and seem to not cover anything, yet he finds a way to come up with very difficult grading criteria off of what seems like nothing. The TA and discussion sections provided all structure for this course.

Professor Seidenberg wrote the book that is required for the class. His writing is exceptional and I thoroughly enjoyed it... but do not, I repeat, DO NOT take this course. He is the most unprofessional lecturer I have had at Wisconsin, and his grading criteria is completely erratic. His papers and exams are petty--you will be disappointed.

If you engage with him, it's clear you get the most out of the class. He's not the best lecturer, but if you see him outside of class, he knows a ton and is extremely eager to share. Had a great experience in his class, he's an extremely nice person who wants to talk about things that excite him more than he wants to lecture. In general 2 thumbs up

Seidenberg is a really nice guy, don't get me wrong, but his class was the worst class I've ever taken. I've had some experience in the Reading Psychology area, and I found this class random and challenging. The tests did not test comprehension- they tested your ability to memorize an unfinished textbook he was making. Would NOT recommend.

Never take this class with him.  He is an amazing researcher and has a lot of knowledge in the field, but he does not know how to express it in a lecture and is very vague in what he wants you to know.  If you take the class take a preliminary mind and brain class, probably with MaryEllen McDonald.

I don't understand why people would ever rate this man as a good professor. He is incredibly unclear, mundane and boring lectures, extremely unspecific in what he wants out of assignments, among many other things. He may be a nice/awkward man, but as far as his teaching is concerned, please do not take this class.

Seidenberg is a great professor. He's really passionate about reading, and the class is way more interesting than I had expected. I was really surprised to read such low ratings, because I really loved his lectures. He's a nice guy, and he barely gives any readings. As long as you go to class, you'll do well on the tests.

Mark is very passionate about what he does. I would recommend the class only because it actually is a lot more interesting than it sounds...not a lot of outside class work. However, if you can avoid having him as a TA (you get him as a TA if you are in honors) because all he does it rant for an hour and it is soooo boring/pointless.

Mark's an eccentric guy. He's a very busy man, sometimes lives in his own world a little bit, and sometimes that can get in the way of how organized he is in presenting material. He's helpful and open to some discussion, but tries to stay on course so will shut things down if they deviate too far from being relevant. Course is generally easy.

I don't typially use this website, and have never left a rating, but I felt compelled to do so because professor Seidenberg is getting a bad reputation that he doesn't deserve on this website.  He is nice,  open to questions/suggestions, helpful, and cares about his students.  Give him a break.  He is the best at what he does, so take his class.

One of the worst professors Ive had. The assignments are pointless. I've learned nothing in the class and he still has no idea who I am despite the fact that we've met outside of class multiple times. He's a terrible teacher. Don't take this class, you will absolutely regret it. Considering putting in an official complaint with the psych department

I could seriously rant about this guy for an hour. I was pretty nervous about taking his class after seeing a rating of around 2.0 on this site, but Prof. Seidenberg has been my best professor at Madison thus far. The information is really intuitive and can be mastered with very little work outside of class. He is so flexible and easy to work with.

he was completely disorganized as a professor. His multiple choice questions were meant to trick you (even if you knew your stuff the amount of detail he requires is absolutely ridiculous!) When you are answering his short answer don't be concise! write EVERYONE you know about the topic. Keep in mind he thinks he's a lot cooler than he is!!!!!!!!!!

He is teaching this class with no textbook and is extremely open to student feedback. The fact that he's so open to suggestions shows that he cares that his students do well. He does seem bland sometimes and like he has something else better to do but the guy studies words for a job.. He actually changes things based on feedback too. Not a bad guy!

i've never personally talked to him, but he seems really condescending, like he has way better things to do than give lectures. doesn't seem like he likes interacting with students very much, either. i wish there were another professor to teach this class; i wouldn't recommend taking it unless you can tolerate a bad prof. and teach yourself.

He was the WORST prof I have ever had; condescending and rude. He does not respond to emails, nor is he in his office during scheduled hours. Thank god he had an awesome TA! As for grading, there were 3 exams (25%, 25%, 50%)which were all multiple choice. There was no textbook; all reading materials were online. Thank him for saving paper at least.
